summary: Internal email chain from August 23, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office discussing logistical and funding challenges for victims wanting to attend a hearing in the United States v. Epstein case in the Southern District of New York. The emails highlight requests from victims worldwide for travel, hotel, and per diem support.

events.title: Hearing on Nolle Prosequi Order
events.description: A hearing is scheduled for 10:30 AM in the Southern District of New York regarding the proposed nolle prosequi order in United States v. Epstein. Victims and their counsel are expected to be heard.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, in the Southern States v. Epstein case to address a proposed nolle prosequi order.
Multiple victims from locations including Australia and Barcelona expressed interest in attending the hearing in New York.
Victims requested transportation, hotel accommodations, and per diem support to attend, posing a logistical and funding challenge for the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Internal emails show coordination between the Southern District of New York and the Executive Office for United States Attorneys in Washington, D.C., regarding victim funding.
The document indicates the hearing was intended to allow victims and their counsel to be heard by the court.
